title.narrative: RENOVATED KORANIC TEACHING (RKT)

description.narrative: Young children, including those with disabilities, benefit from Renovated Koranic School readiness programmes, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children aged 0-5, especially the most vulnerable, receive integral development care and are prepared for primary school.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Young children, including those with disabilities, benefit from Renovated Koranic School readiness programmes

description.narrative: A big step was taken in the institutionalization and generalization of preschool in the Comoros with a new education orientation law promulgated in January 2021, thanks to UNICEF’s advocacy for many years.23,680 children completed a preschool programme (coverage rate of over 31%).UNICEF contributed to the provision of a quality preschool programme by supporting a multifaceted intervention package for preschool children, which installed outdoor play equipment and improved classrooms learning environment.Preschool children received hygienic and protective equipment as part of the implementation of the national plan for the prevention of COVID in schools. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
